page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: {This area is predominantly rural with {a small residential development and a {few industries and trades occurring {within it. {The farms include dairy and {stock-rearing on grassland,both {intensively managed and rough grazing {with some arable cropping. {The river Urr meanders its way across {the area on its way to the Solway at {Palnackie. Along its banks granite is {extracted,made into blocks and used to {mix concrete. An old mill which once {used its water is now a distribution {depot for agricultural supplies. {At the quiter end of Dalbeattie High {Street behind an unlikely facade is {housed a busy garment manufacturer.As {this road leads to forrest walks it {passes the few traders in the area.The {leisure facilities include river {fishing and playing fields. }
